name: Migrating from KIAM to Service accounts : Why and how .txt - Main Content
description: This section explains the process of migrating from KIAM (Kubernetes IAM Authenticator) to using AWS Service Accounts for accessing AWS resources from within a Kubernetes cluster. It highlights the advantages of using Service Accounts, such as eliminating the need for user authentication, avoiding rate-limiting issues, and reducing latency. The section also provides step-by-step instructions for creating Service Accounts for Kubernetes cluster namespaces, including prerequisites and different scenarios based on whether the required IAM role already exists or needs to be created.
use_cases: Migrating from KIAM to Service Accounts for accessing AWS resources from Kubernetes clusters
Eliminating rate-limiting and latency issues caused by KIAM's architecture
Enabling high-concurrency workloads to access AWS APIs without bottlenecks
Creating Service Accounts for Kubernetes cluster namespaces with appropriate IAM roles
capabilities: Providing prerequisites for creating Service Accounts
Describing different scenarios for creating Service Accounts
Offering step-by-step instructions for creating Service Accounts
Enabling direct access to AWS Metadata APIs from Kubernetes Pods
